amendment.description: Amendment in the nature of a substitute sought to allow Medicare Select Insurance policies to be offered in all 50 States, but would have limited such availability to five years; prohibit premium increases for the supplemental insurance based on the age of the policy holder; and allow policy holders to leave Medicare Select programs.
amendment.purpose: An amendment in the nature of a substitute, similar to the provisions of the bill, to allow Medicare Select Insurance policies to be offered in all 50 States, but would limit the such availability to five years. The substitute would prohibit premium increases for the supplemental insurance based on the age of the policy holder, and would allow policy holders to leave Medicare Select programs

action.text: Amendment (A001) in the nature of a substitute offered by Mr. Waxman.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Waxman amendment (A001) Failed by recorded vote: 175 - 246 (Roll no. 301).
